variants.Description in input context: The K48A mutation had little effect on the stability of the parkin Ubld or ubiquitin indicating that this mutation contributes to defective protein-protein interactions.

The single point mutation R42P in parkin's Ubld caused poor expression and degradation of the protein. To avoid these problems, a GB1-Ubld fusion protein was characterized by NMR spectroscopy to show that the R42P mutation causes the complete unfolding of the parkin Ubld.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Urea unfolding experiments and NMR spectroscopy

Material used.Material Name: Parkin ubiquitin-like domain (Ubld) and GB1-Ubld fusion protein
Material used.Description: The experiments were conducted using recombinant parkin Ubld and GB1-Ubld fusion protein.

Readout description.Result Description: The K48A mutation had little effect on the stability of the parkin Ubld or ubiquitin indicating that this mutation contributes to defective protein-protein interactions.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Complete unfolding of the parkin Ubld
Readout description.Result Description: The R42P mutation caused poor expression and degradation of the protein. The GB1-Ubld fusion protein characterization by NMR spectroscopy showed that the R42P mutation causes the complete unfolding of the parkin Ubld.
